plugins.name: Token -> Code
plugins.description:
The plugin read elements you select and let you export them into Html with SACSS.


If the element with Auto layout it goes to flex.


* SACSS„Äå Static Atomic css „Äç: Each css selector with only one css rules.


Five Tabs:


  1. HTML: Elements => HTML;
  2. CSS: Element Style => CSS;
  3. Token: get Base Token Info;
  4. Config: Config the whole project;
  5. Help: for help;


There are 2 way to use Token to code.


1. Pure way:


This way you need config nothing.


Just open plugin and select the element. The element will transform to the Static Atomic CSS like below.


  • font-sizeÔºö .fs12{ font-size: 12px; };
  • font-weightÔºö.fw700{ font-weight: 700; };
  • font-styleÔºöfsi{ font-style: italic; };
  • line-heightÔºö.lh16{ line-height: 16px; };
  • text-alignÔºötac{ text-align: center; };
  • text-transformÔºö.ttc{ text-transform: capitalize; };
  • padding: .pb16{ padding-bottom:16px; }
  • flex: .df{ display:flex; }
  • ...


you need `$ npm install sacss` first.


https://www.npmjs.com/package/sacss


All style in SACSS will ignore.


Wanna known more about SACSS?


https://s-acss.github.io/


2. Custom way:


You can custom each token through the figma token id.


When the generator match the rules, it will turn out to be the code as you custom.


The other stuff you don't give alias will use SACSS instead.


2.1 Custom Base node


{
  "tokens": {
   [id]: {
      "_tokenName": "effet1",
      "_tokenType": "EFFECT",
      "DEFAULT": {
        "className": ["g_shadow1"],
        "_ignoreClassName": []
      }
    }
  }
}


this will output the node with `g_shadow` class


2.1 Custom depend the node type


{
  "tokens": {
    [id]: {
      "_tokenName": "figma node name",
      "_tokenType": "COMPONENT",
      "DEFAULT": {
        "type": "primary",
        "size": "large",
        "tagName": "Button",
        "className": [],
        "children": true,
        "_ignoreClassName": [],
        "_renderHeight": true,
        "_renderWidth": true
      }
    }
  }
}


it will render like :


`<Button type="primary" size="large">button</Button>`


Component will ignore Height and Width default, if you wanna it you can set renderHeight add `_renderWidth` to be true


Token


  • fill
  • text
  • effect
  • stroke
  • grid
  • effect
  • component
  • padding
  • flex


Anything can turn out to be code is calling Token.


FAG


1. I can't open the plugin of SACSS in the first time?

Try 3 times and wait.


2. How to ignore some element?

Just set those element name with `_` start.

exp: `_header`

accepted.name: ziven27
accepted.description: Be you

plugins.name: Pack
plugins.description:
Pack allows you to generate a circle packing pattern withing a frame.


Circle packing is the process of arranging circles within a given boundary such that none of them overlap.


Usage

  1. Select a Frame to being
  2. Bring up Pack from the plugin context menu
  3. Select which shape to render


Pack offers two choices: square or circle. This is the shape that will be used to generate the pattern.

plugins.name: ICONS SQUEEZE MACHINE
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that allows you to merge multiple `SVG` paths into a single one for selected icons and then save them as a `JSON` file.


üì∫ Youtube demo

ü§ñ Icons to test

üëæ GitHub Page


--


What is the plugin for


In case if you use icons in a project as an `Icon` component, important to store all assets in one place and as compact as possible. In this case it better to load only one `path d` instead of store multiple paths for one SVG icon.


If you not familiar with the method check this article


So the plugin cuts the chain ‚õìÔ∏è: export icons ‚Üí load to icomoon.io ‚Üí export and save font ‚Üí extract `JSON` ‚Üí clean it. üèÅ


With the plugin the chain should be ‚õìÔ∏è: export icons. üèÅ


--


How to use


  1. Run the plugin.
  2. Select your icons set. Important ‚Äî icons should be selected, not the only one frame where they are. In this case the plugin will try to merge all icons into one within this frame.
  3. Click on the `Preview` button.
  4. Check that all icons are displayed as they should.
  5. Click on the `Download JSON` button.


Plugin will generate `ZIP` folder with `JSON` file and `HTML` file that will preview all icons from the saved `JSON`.


--


How it works


The full `SVG` code for an icon will be:

<svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">

<path d="M8 15C8.55228 15 9 14.5523 9 14C9 13.4477 8.55228 13 8 13C7.44772 13 7 13.4477 7 14C7 14.5523 7.44772 15 8 15Z" fill="#17191C"/>

<path d="M12 15C12.5523 15 13 14.5523 13 14C13 13.4477 12.5523 13 12 13C11.4477 13 11 13.4477 11 14C11 14.5523 11.4477 15 12 15Z" fill="#17191C"/>

<path d="M17 14C17 14.5523 16.5523 15 16 15C15.4477 15 15 14.5523 15 14C15 13.4477 15.4477 13 16 13C16.5523 13 17 13.4477 17 14Z" fill="#17191C"/>

<rect x="7" y="1" width="2" height="2" fill="#17191C"/>

<rect x="15" y="1" width="2" height="2" fill="#17191C"/>

<path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M2 7C2 4.79086 3.79086 3 6 3H7V5H9V3H15V5H17V3H18C20.2091 3 22 4.79086 22 7V17C22 19.2091 20.2091 21 18 21H6C3.79086 21 2 19.2091 2 17V7ZM4 9V17C4 18.1046 4.89543 19 6 19H18C19.1046 19 20 18.1046 20 17V9H4Z" fill="#17191C"/>

</svg>


The shortened code generated by the plugin will be:

"M8 15C8.55228 15 9 14.5523 9 14C9 13.4477 8.55228 13 8 13C7.44772 13 7 13.4477 7 14C7 14.5523 7.44772 15 8 15Z M12 15C12.5523 15 13 14.5523 13 14C13 13.4477 12.5523 13 12 13C11.4477 13 11 13.4477 11 14C11 14.5523 11.4477 15 12 15Z M16 15C16.5523 15 17 14.5523 17 14C17 13.4477 16.5523 13 16 13C15.4477 13 15 13.4477 15 14C15 14.5523 15.4477 15 16 15Z M9 1H7V3H6C3.79086 3 2 4.79086 2 7V17C2 19.2091 3.79086 21 6 21H18C20.2091 21 22 19.2091 22 17V7C22 4.79086 20.2091 3 18 3H17V1H15V3H9V1ZM9 3V5H7V3H9ZM4 17V9H20V17C20 18.1046 19.1046 19 18 19H6C4.89543 19 4 18.1046 4 17Z M15 3V5H17V3H15Z"


--


Possible issues


  • Failed union Boolean operation. Icon elements were merged incorrectly. Solution ‚Äî fix vector shapes manually ‚Äî flatten shapes and outline curves. Sometimes the layers order could be an issue.
  • You selected a frame with icons but not icons. Please, note that you need to select icons, not the parent frame.


--


Plugin doesn't run any custom code to outline, flatten and union icons, it uses only figma API methods

plugins.name: Ultimate Blob Maker Designer
plugins.description:
Create Stunning SVG Blobs:

With the Ultimate Blob Maker Designer, generate fully customizable SVG blobs that seamlessly integrate into Figma.


Unmatched Customization Options:

Choose from filled, outlined, gradient, stacked, dual, patterned, and blurred blobs‚Äîmix and match to create unique designs like black hole effects or intricate patterns.


Instant Figma Integration:

Insert blobs directly into your Figma project with a click, whether through the context menu or the "Insert to Figma" button. The plugin guarantees full SVG compatibility pro users or PNG, eliminating issues with unsupported formats.


Advanced Design Controls:


Fill & Outline: Change fill color, border color, and adjust border width with ease.

Pattern Blobs: Choose from over 180 patterns and adjust the pattern size to fit your design vision.

Gradient Blobs: Create complex gradients with up to 7 colors, selecting between linear or radial styles.

Blur Effects: Adjust blur intensity for dynamic and soft focus effects.

Shape Complexity: Fine-tune vertices and complexity to craft blobs that range from chaotic to smooth.

Copy & Customize SVG Code:

Easily copy the SVG code directly from the plugin for further customization or reuse.


Unlike many other blob plugins or websites:

* Other plugins struggle with SVG compatibility, but the Ultimate Blob Maker Designer ensures your blobs insert perfectly into Figma. Experience the ultimate tool for blob design with unparalleled options and flawless performance.

Choose from filled, outlined, gradient, stacked, dual, patterned, and blurred blobs‚Äîmix and match to create unique designs like black hole effects or intricate patterns.


Instant Figma Integration:

Insert blobs directly into your Figma project with a click, whether through the context menu or the "Insert to Figma" button. The plugin guarantees full SVG compatibility pro users or PNG, eliminating issues with unsupported formats.


Advanced Design Controls:


Fill & Outline: Change fill color, border color, and adjust border width with ease.

Pattern Blobs: Choose from over 180 patterns and adjust the pattern size to fit your design vision.

Gradient Blobs: Create complex gradients with up to 7 colors, selecting between linear or radial styles.

Blur Effects: Adjust blur intensity for dynamic and soft focus effects.

Shape Complexity: Fine-tune vertices and complexity to craft blobs that range from chaotic to smooth.

Copy & Customize SVG Code:

Easily copy the SVG code directly from the plugin for further customization or reuse.


Unlike many other blob plugins or websites:

* Other plugins struggle with SVG compatibility, but the Ultimate Blob Maker Designer ensures your blobs insert perfectly into Figma. Experience the ultimate tool for blob design with unparalleled options and flawless performance.

plugins.name: Variables to Frames: Publish and Sync
plugins.description:
Are you tired of manually organizing and sharing your design variables? Say hello to the "Variables to Frame" Figma plugin, your go-to solution for effortlessly creating organized frames containing your variable collections.

Take your design collaboration to the next level by easily sharing and printing these frames with your team in various formats.


Key Features:

  1. Automated Frame Creation: With just a few clicks, this plugin takes your variable collections and generates dedicated frames for each of them. No more manual frame setup ‚Äì it's all done for you!


  1. Flexible Arrangement: Arrange your variables within the frames just the way you want. The frames are designed to accommodate variables in rows, giving you the freedom to rearrange them as needed.


  1. Visual Customization: Each variable is treated as a component, allowing you to make visual adjustments on the fly. Tailor your design variables to meet your project's specific requirements effortlessly.


Simple Export Process:

  1. Open the plugin right within Figma.
  2. Navigate to a free space on your canvas.
  3. Click the "Publish Collection" button.
  4. Watch as each of your variable collections is transformed into a dedicated frame.


User-Friendly and Free:

The "Variables to Frame" is designed to be super user-friendly, ensuring that you can effortlessly export your variable collections without any hassle. Best of all, it's completely free to use!


Unlock a new level of convenience and organization in your design workflow with the "Variables to Frame" Figma plugin. Download it today and streamline your variable management like never before!

plugins.name: Variant Switcher
plugins.description:
The Variant Switcher plugin recursively changes component instances to a different variant based on the specified property.


If you have a lot of different components in your design system that share a same property (e.g., "theme"), you can use this plugin to switch them to the same property value (e.g., "theme=dark theme").


Video tutorial on YouTube.


Usage

The Variant Switcher plugin has three main input fields:

  1. Property Name: the property you want to change
  2. From Variant: (Optional) the current value you want to target (leave blank to select all instances with the selected property regardless of the current value)
  3. To Variant: the new value you want to set the property


And a few advanced options:

  1. Deep Switch: When unchecked, the plugin will not switch children after switching parent instance. (Diagram explanation)
  2. Switch Full Document: When checked, the plugin will traverse through the entire document. When unchecked, the plugin will only switch the current selection, or the current page if nothing is selected.
  3. Exact match: Whether to do an exact match or a fuzzy search
  4. Plugin stays open: Whether the plugin will stay open after clicking "Switch variants"
  5. Main Component Name: (Optional) Change only instances with the specified main component name


Contact Us

  1. üêõBugs report or feature request? https://github.com/etn-ccis/blui-figma-plugins/issues
  2. ‚úâÔ∏èGeneral inquiries? brightlayer-ui@eaton.com
  3. ‚ù§Ô∏è Visit our home page! brightlayer-ui.github.io

plugins.name: Dynamic Component Resizer
plugins.description:
With this plugin, you'll be able to setup components and resize their instances while maintaining the spacings that you've set in the master. This is done to maintain spacing for when the height of an element has changed in the instance, i.e. if you have text change from 1 line to 2. 

Requirements:

Master components are required to have a frame, the plugin looks for this. Within the frame you must have 2 elements; these are the ones that you'll fill up with content and will change from instance to instance. This usually is a "header" and "body copy" (see artwork picture above). 

The frame must have the following settings:
- Either contrained "top and bottom" or "scale" (vertical) 

The top element must have the following settings:
- Constrained to the top
- Grow vertically (for text)
- Align top (for text)

The bottom element must have the following settings:
-  Contrained to the bottom
- Grow vertically (for text)
- Align bottom (for text)

If you've done this setup, open up the plugin modal, select the element or elements you want to resize and click "run". 

The plugin will run it's magic. It will maintain the space between the two elements within the frame (in the example in the artwork, 20px). If you want to change the spacing, adjust the master, then select the elements and return the plugin. 

I will create an automatic resizer when figma allows for long lasting plugins. 

Any other feedback, feel free to email me at daniel_maddock@intuit.com

plugins.name: Grid Creator
plugins.description:
README

Introduce

This plugin is used to assist designers in creating grid systems in graphic design projects, and the measurement and creation steps of grid systems refer to the book Grid Systems in Graphic Design.


How to use

Paper selection / Type area settings

  • Set the paper size in the Paper field
  • Set the paper orientation in the Orient field
  • Set the center margin to Golden Ratio or Custom in the Type area (selecting the Golden Ratio system will set the default margin according to the existing configuration, and the designer can modify the margin value according to the actual situation)

Columns / grid modules

  • Set the number of columns of the grid system in the Col num field
  • Set the column spacing of the grid system in the Col gap field
  • Set the number of grid modules for each column of the grid system in the Grid num
  • Set the grid module spacing of the grid system in the Grid gap field

Typography settings

  • Set the height of the text line you want to put into the grid system in Line height
  • Cap height: If the text has Vertical trim: Cap height to base line enabled, you need to assign a value here, otherwise keep the default

Calculate

  • Click the Calculate button to precompute the relevant math of the grid system

Adjust

  • Click the Adjust button to optimize the amount of math (e.g. decimal rounding)

Generate

  • Click Generate to create a grid system in the figma canvas


References

  1. M√ºller-Brockmann, Josef. Grid Systems in Graphic Design: A Visual Communication Manual for Graphic Designers, Typographers and Three Dimensional Designers = Raster Systeme F√ºr Die Visuelle Gestaltung: Ein Handbuch F√ºr Grafiker, Typografen Und Ausstellungsgestalter. 18th edition. Salenstein: Niggli, 2021.
plugins.tagline: Use Grid Creator to assist you in creating a grid system in graphic design.

plugins.name: FluentC Translation and Localization
plugins.description:
Localizing an application or design with FluentC is a seamless process. The FluentC Figma plug-in allows you to easily translate your text into 75 different languages with just a few simple steps.


Simply select the text you want to translate, choose the source language, and select the target language. Once you hit the "translate" button, a new layer containing the translated text will be inserted into your design. This process can be repeated as many times as needed, with all translations being stored in your FluentC account for easy access by your development team.


With FluentC, your development team can easily take the text from your designs and insert it directly into the production applications, streamlining the localization process.


Try FluentC for free, with advanced plugin features available through a FluentC subscription. Learn more at https://www.fluentc.io.


There are many challenges with designing an application that supports multiple languages. One of those challenges is getting the design text translated quickly and integrated into existing design tools that can keep pace with rapid prototyping. Missing an opportunity to test a user interface in a person‚Äôs native language could adversely impact building a multi-language application. Transferring the multi-language content to a development team with accuracy is an ongoing challenge throughout the design process. Solutions to this problem need to evolve as these challenges constantly arise which causes these applications not to support multiple languages.





Developing a user interface involves dozens of revisions as an idea turns from low-fidelity wireframes into high-fidelity prototypes. There are many activities that a design team takes, such as peer feedback and leadership feedback that create many points of change in the text and content of a design. These changes need to be translated quickly so the designer can check the design concepts and ensure that all graphic elements are appropriate for a given space or element. Machine-based automated translation can serve these needs quickly due to the limited need for highly accurate translations. Speed of translation and tool integration are the key features that any solution needs to support.


The solution needs to integrate into the design teams prototyping tools like Figma. The pace and speed of multi-language prototypes require a solution that can deliver value without impacting the design process.

Best practices for the design process are to have a new user experience tested with potential users, which is how the best designs are tested. All too often this testing is done in a single language even though some of the test users may not be native speakers of the source language. This is one of the biggest challenges because the opportunity to learn something new is lost. The challenge of translation is placed on the test user and this puts the user in a position to understand something and comment on it. Even though the design team may not speak the language, the designer could use a fast translation tool that could quickly and accurately translate the prototype into the test user‚Äôs native language. The test user only must translate the feedback and not the entire application and design. The value generated by rapidly changing a prototype to a user‚Äôs native language can be a be the difference between building an application that is breaking down barriers to new users and building a wall that cannot be taken down.


The last step in the design process is the most critical and where most of the design process breaks down. Even if you get over the first two challenges, the engineering team still needs to build the application. A rapid translation tool needs to be able to deliver that content in the development environment just as fast as the design team creates it. This challenge is even more important when building software in an Agile way. Sprint over sprint the product owners and analysts need to copy the text from the designs and transfer it into detailed documentation. This can lead to errors of omission and errors of accuracy. The solution to this needs to be able to be integrated into Figma and be available in common development libraries (REST, GraphQL).


FluentC solves these challenges in a single tool. FluentC has rapid and quick translation, best-in-class machine translation, and is available in over 75 languages. This means that when you know the native language of a test user, your prototype can quickly respond to their native language. All the translations and source content are available instantly for the development team to incorporate into an application. The speed that FluentC can enable a design and development team to achieve is a unique feature that makes FluentC a must-have for multi-language application development.

accepted.name: FluentC
accepted.description: A communication company making it simple to build multiple language applications

plugins.tagline: Streamline your translation with FluentC: Translate designs with ease and bring your vision gloabl

plugins.name: Variables & Styles List for Devs
plugins.description:
This plugin allows developers to lists all local variables and export them to JSON as a tokens.json file or CSS with custom properties.


Tokens.json


For JSON code generation, you can apply custom settings achieve the best result for your needs, such as:

  1. Unit settings
  2. Tab size
  3. Separate collections in single files
  4. Automatically abbreviate collection names
  5. Use dimensions for numbers
  6. Generate text values


Tokens.css


Custom properties, also knows as CSS variables, can also be customized:

  1. Unit settings
  2. Tab size
  3. Separate collections in single files
  4. Automatically abbreviate collection names
  5. Collection name prefix
  6. Custom prefix
  7. Show description as CSS comments
  8. Color value type (hex, rgb or hsl)
  9. Generate text values

plugins.name: Image compressor
plugins.description:
Overview

Image Compressor is a versatile and powerful plugin designed to streamline the image compression process within Figma. Whether you're working on a single image or need to compress multiple images in bulk, Image Compressor has you covered.


With two distinct modes - "Bulk" and "Advanced" - this plugin offers a range of features to help you achieve optimal image compression for your projects.


Bulk Mode

  • Select images to compress;
  • Open the plugin in Bulk mode, configure the name, export formats, compression level, and specify the sizes to reduce the image to separated by commas;
  • Click download and choose a location to save the archive with all the compressed image variations.

Advanced Mode

  • Select an image to compress;
  • Open the plugin in Advanced mode, configure the name, and choose the format;
  • Adjust the size and quality until you achieve the perfect image for you;
  • Click download and choose a location to save the compressed image.


In Advanced mode, you can also insert the compressed image into a design by clicking the "Insert" button. We recommend using this button only for design tasks (e.g., inserting a pixelated version of the image). For development purposes, it is recommended to download the compressed images directly.


Benefits

  • Optimal Image Quality: Image Compressor employs advanced algorithms to reduce file sizes while preserving image quality, ensuring your visuals remain sharp and vibrant.
  • Save Disk Space: Keep your project files light and nimble by significantly reducing the storage space required for images.
  • Faster Load Times: Compressed images load faster on websites and digital platforms, enhancing user experience.
  • Streamlined Workflow: Simplify your design workflow by integrating Image Compressor to conveniently download compressed images.
  • Increased Productivity: Whether you're dealing with a single image or a bulk export, this plugin allowing you to focus on your creative work, all images can be easily downloaded by developers in the required sizes.


Now it works fine with jpg, webp and png. We will continue to update this plugin to fully unleash the power of image compression and take your creative projects to the next level.


Try Image Compressor today and revolutionize your image compression workflow. Achieve the perfect balance between image quality and file size with ease, whether you're working on a single image or exporting a batch.
plugins.tagline: Compress images, convert to webp, bulk download, minify, mimimize, resize, picture, web optmize

plugins.name: Titleitos Title Maker
plugins.description:
Titleitos: basic (Medium)


Create titles and comments with a click of a button.

It's that simple.


Use a keyboard shortcut, or select Titleitos from your plugins menu (or just type it on cmd bar CMD+/) and that's it! you made a titleito!


If you select an Object / Frame and use the Titleitos plugin, the title will appear above on the y axis. If not, it will just float on your screen for fast use.


How to add a keyboard shortcut (Mac)?

  1. Go to System Preferences
  2. Search for Keyboard
  3. Click on Shortcuts tab
  4. Search for "App Shortcuts"
  5. Add Figma.app
  6. Click on the + and Type in: "Titleitos Title Maker"
  7. Chose your shortcut by typing for example: CMD+Option+Shift+/
  8. That's it!


Enjoy!


(I made this plugin for my own use, but why not to share it?)
plugins.tagline: Add title above anything

plugins.name: Icon Preview
plugins.description:
Effortlessly preview your icons in real-time across preset sizes for web, iOS, and Android. The plugin intelligently detects when you're editing an icon and instantly displays a live preview of the selected icon, making it seamless to fine-tune designs without interrupting your workflow. Perfect for designers who want to ensure pixel-perfect icons across platforms with minimal effort.


Previewing an icon


  1. Select an icon and run the plugin (must be a square frame, component or instance).
  2. Scroll or resize the window to see different icon sizes.


Locking the preview


To lock the preview to the current icon just click the lock icon in the top right of the plugin window.


Changing background colour


Change plugin window background automatically changes colour based on the parent background colour of the icon.


Things to note


The plugin currently only supports square icons up to 512px.

accepted.name: Gavin McFarland
accepted.description: Freelance Designer and Developer who loves making things

plugins.name: Variable Visualizer
plugins.description:
Variable Visualizer (VV)


Transform how you work with Figma variables. VV turns complex variable relationships into an intuitive visual map, letting you see and manage all your variables in one infinite canvas.


Key Features


  1. View all variable collections at once on an infinite canvas
  2. Visualize and create variable connections through simple drag-and-drop
  3. Simulate different modes to preview how variables behave without building components
  4. Quick-search variables and jump directly to them
  5. See all variables used in any selected layer or component


VV makes designing Figma variables feel less like navigating a dark forest and more like having a clear map at hand.


Quick Start


  1. Open the plugin to see all your variable collections laid out visually
  2. Drag between ports to create variable connections
  3. Use mode simulation to test different variable states
  4. Search or select layers to find specific variables


Whether you're new to Figma variables or managing complex design systems, VV helps you understand and control your variables with confidence.

accepted.name: Mr. Biscuit
accepted.description: https://www.figma.com/@mrbiscuit

plugins.tagline: Visualize and manage Figma variables with ease

plugins.name: Shuffle
plugins.description:
Randomize your grid! This plugin visually reorders your layers.


How to use

Just select some layers and use it via Quick Actions or Plugin menu. If you don't like the result, press Cmd/Ctrl+Alt+P a few times.


If you select only one group, the plugin will shuffle its contents.


How it works

The plugin will store layers' positions, mix them and reassign to selected layers. Shuffle is perfect for grid-aligned items. However, it works with everything.


Roadmap

Shuffle is simple, fast and non-disruptive. It just does its work. If you still have any ideas on how to make it better, leave a comment or contact me.


Problem? Idea? Kind words?

You can contact me via e-mail at nick.denq@gmail.com.

But the most rapid way is Telegram.

This project is open sourced on Github.


Don't hesitate, I'd like to know your thoughts on this plugin (or we can talk about anything else).


<3

plugins.name: Screens Organizer
plugins.description:
How to use

A. Place all your screens inside sections, and press "Organize this page" all sections will be placed in the right order, and all other elements will be placed inside the "Misc" section


B. Add a prefix for each of your screens with "/" separation (ex. "section_name/layer_name) and press "Organize this page", all elements with the same prefix will be placed in their sections


Properties

Add color styles to sections - will add the style "figma/section" for all sections, and "figma/section_headline" for the headline if it was not created before, afterwords you able to change the style into whatever you want


Add header to sections - will add a header for each 1st level section (you're also capable to create sections inside, but not headline)


Move all components to separate page - Will move all components and variants to the "Components" page, if the page hasn't existed yet, it will also create it


Roadmap

  • Core order functionality
  • User interface
  • Headline & color styles
  • Black theme for UI
  • Index page with sections links
  • Thumbnail generator
  • Headline selection for sections
  • ...

Add header to sections - will add a header for each 1st level section (you're also capable to create sections inside, but not headline)


Move all components to separate page - Will move all components and variants to the "Components" page, if the page hasn't existed yet, it will also create it


Roadmap

  • Core order functionality
  • User interface
  • Headline & color styles
  • Black theme for UI
  • Index page with sections links
  • Thumbnail generator
  • Headline selection for sections
  • ...

All sections inside sections inside... now also will be ordered

plugins.name: Cardsorting
plugins.description:
Create structures and download the result in CSV which you could open in Excel, Google Docs or Airtable.


How to use

  1. Create a list of cards (frame + name in text element) of the same color and use also the other same color for the highest category cards (also frame + name in text element).
  2. Sort cards by creating new categories and sub categories (could be every color). Put children cards in side the parent frame.
  3. Store every participant on the own page.


Example of the file: https://www.figma.com/file/oqawfzHcI4UCz1VSBD34Jb/Plugin-Card-Sorting?node-id=0%3A1

plugins.name: Send to Components Page
plugins.description:
If you prefer to keep your components on a separate page and are tired of carrying them manually, this plugin is for you.


1. Select any number of Components. Frame, group, or just group selection will also work.


2. Call the plugin. All components from the selection will be transferred to a separate Components page and placed in a special Unsorted Components frame. Components will be replaced with instances.


The plugin has two independent commands to choose from:


Send to components page

(tip: For a quick search, type snc)

When this command is invoked, the Components are sent to a separate page while staying on the same page.


Send to components page and go

(tip: for a quick search, print sngo)

When this command is invoked, after moving components the focus is moved to the components page, and all newly transferred components are selected.


All components are placed in a special frame only for predictability, and you are welcome to extract the characters from the frame and organize them as you wish. See it as a predictable arrival point for new components.


Although the presence of components in the frame will not prevent further calls (i.e. you can securely call the plugin several times in a row), the plugin looks up at the contents of the frame every time, so for better performance, it makes sense to keep it as empty as possible.


A few details:


- If you already have a page named "Components" or "Symbols", the plugin will use it to place its frame. If the page doesn't exist plugin will create it and use afterward.

- If the page or frame has been deleted, the plugin will recreate the new ones at the next call

- You can rename the components page or frame as you wish.

accepted.name: Vadim Pleshkov
accepted.description: Product Designer

plugins.tagline: Extract components to separate page

plugins.name: SVG Exporter
plugins.description:
The SVG Exporter is a simple and fast SVG export tool. It can export SVG files based on your presets.


Features:


  1. Set file prefix
  2. Remove the width and height tags from the SVG, allowing it to respond to the size of the parent element.
  3. Remove colors, you can re-enter them as #FFFFFF, var(--css-variable), or currentColor.
  4. Add gradients, which differ from the Figma canvas in that you can use CSS variables or currentColor to allow for better CSS control.
  5. Simple path animation, if your SVG graphics are drawn with strokes, it can automatically add simple CSS path animations to enhance interactivity, without needing to set animation effects individually for a large number of icons. (the presentation effect has its limitations)
plugins.tagline: Using simple SVG path animations to enhance interactivity
